main event: On July 21, 1949, a strong white light streaked across the sky from east to west in Darien, Georgia.
interesting points: The object was first seen as a white light with an afterglow that turned flame-colored before disappearing instantly., The sighting lasted less than one minute., Several witnesses, including a group in a car, reported the event., The light appeared to travel faster than any aircraft typically seen in the area., The night was cloudy with no visible stars during the sighting.
sighted object: strong white light with an afterglow
witness description: Groups of individuals in cars, including names mentioned in the report.
